dialogue: He is with God.
Sede vacante. The throne of the Holy See is vacant.
Aldo...
Thomas, I’m so sorry. I know His Holiness had no closer colleagues than you and Aldo... But I asked Janusz to hold off calling you. I... I wanted to ascertain all the facts.
Well, I’m sure you acted for the best.
The way rumours can spread. One and a quarter billion souls watching.
I’ve prepared a time-line of His Holiness’ last day.
The Holy Father’s most recent medical records. He had an angiogram last month.
You can see the evidence of a blockage...just here.
Joe, perhaps...perhaps we could release the data, but not the photograph? It feels too...too....
I know, Thomas, I know. But there will have to be an autopsy.
Thomas!
Is he smuggling in his private Chef?
How many is that, Willi?
I’m enjoying the mystery Thomas but I suppose you should tell me what you want to talk about?
Your last meeting with the Holy Father.
Uhuh? What about it?
I’ve been told it was difficult. Was it?
Difficult? No? Not that I can recall.
I’m sorry to have to ask this, Joe, but... To be specific, I was told that the Holy Father demanded your resignation.
That’s absurd. I don’t know what... who told you?
Archbishop Wozniak.
Why would he say such a thing?
So, there isn’t any truth in the allegation?
God, no, of course not! It’s absurd. You didn’t think...?
I had to ask.
No, I understand, of course. But, no. You can ask Monsignor Morales. He was at the meeting.
I would but at the moment we happen to be sequestered.
Can you think of any reason why Archbishop Wozniak would circulate such a story?
I can’t. I really...coffee? I’m quite... I’m shocked. He told you this himself?
Do you think...?
What?

The drinking? I don’t like to bring it up, but w e both know his drinking has been getting heavier and perhaps it’s affecting his judgement, his mind even? I know my name has been mentioned as a future Pope and if the Archbishop does not approve of the idea then perhaps... C
I don’t know. I’m just trying to make sense of... and I know the poor man was shattered by the Holy Father’s death.
Yes. Indeed. Again, Joe, my apologies for...
No, not at all. I quite understand.
What did you discuss with the Holy Father in that final meeting?
Forgive me, but it was a private conversation, Thomas. And very precious. The last words I exchanged with the Holy Father.
I quite understand.
If anyone brings up my name please tell them of my intentions. All I want to do is serve the Conclave. I can’t do that if I’m seen as a contender myself.
Alright.
Of course, a more Machiavellian mind might say it will make you look like a paragon of virtue.
Well, I shall leave you to handle it as you see fit.
I was just on my way to bed.
It won’t take a moment. Come.
I know you enjoy mystery novels Thomas but this is...
I want you to withdraw your name from the next ballot.
You are not the right man to be Pope.
Well, forty of our colleagues would disagree with you, so...
Only because they don’t know you as I do.
This is sad, Thomas. I shall pray for you and...

I know there was some kind of report into your activities. I know the Holy Father raised the matter with you hours befo re he died and that he dismissed you from all your posts. And I know that, somehow, you discovered Adeyemi’s surrender to temptation thirty years ago and arranged for the woman involved to be brought to Rome, with the express intention of destroying Adeyemi’s chance of becoming Pope.
I deny that accusation.
You deny asking our Superioress to transfer one of her sisters to Rome?
The Holy Father’s.
You would libel the Holy Father in his own home?

It isn’t libel, it’s the truth! The Holy Father gave me the name of a sister and asked me to make a private request to bring her to Rome. I had no idea why. And you... You should be careful Thomas. Your own ambition has not gone unnoticed. This might be seen as a tactic to blacken the name of a rival.
That is a d espicable accusation.
Is it? I wonder if you really are so very reluctant to have the chalice passed to you! He makes a visible effort to catch his anger.
I shall pretend this conversation never took place.
But it has taken place!
It’s the report on the activities of Tremblay. It’s an overwhelming prima facie case that he is guilty of simony - an offence that is stipulated in the Holy Scripture as...
You are responsible for this I believe?
No, Your Eminence. You are.
This report is entirely mendacious! It would never have seen the light of day if you had not broken into the Holy Father’s apartment to remove it!
If the report is mendacious then why did the Holy Father, in his last official act as Pope, ask you to resign?
He did no such thing! As Monsignor Morales, who was at the meeting will confirm.
And yet Archbishop Wozniak insists that the Holy Father told him personally of the conversation...
The Holy Father - may his name be numbered among the high priests - was a sick man towards the end of his life as those of us who saw him regularly will confirm!
